description: From Latin quaere, second-person singular present active imperative of quaerō (“seek, look for; ask”).

examples: Had ten dozen of hornets stung him behind in so many places all at one time,—he could not have  […]  started half so much, as with one single quære of three words unseasonably popping in full upon him.

verbs.description: quaere (third-person singular simple present quaeres, present participle quaering or quaereing, simple past and past participle quaered)

entries.meaning: (archaic) To ask or query; used imperatively to introduce a question or signify doubt.
examples: Now, she cannot express her emotions fully: Quaere: will she feel them fully?
